title: How to Draw a Lemur

steps.headline:

\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}Start by drawing a circle.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/4a\/Draw-two-ovals-Step-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/4a\/Draw-two-ovals-Step-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":428,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":706.8,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}Draw an oval at each upper side of the circle head.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/8\/8f\/Sketch-face-Step-3-1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/8\/8f\/Sketch-face-Step-3-1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":420,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":694.1333333333333,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}Sketch the face.
steps.description: Inside the circle draw two small circles. Under the ovals draw an oval with a small circle inside it.

steps.headline: Under the circle head draw a big oval with the lower part tilted to the right.
On the left upper part of the body oval draw a hand.
steps.description: Draw two big vertical overlapping ovals. Draw a circle over the end of the second vertical oval. Draw five flat ovals over the circle.

steps.headline: Under the sketch hand draw a big oval.
steps.description: This will be an upper part of the leg.

steps.headline: Starting from the right lower part of the body oval draw a long curved cylindrical shape reaching over the left upper part of the body oval.
Now neatly outline the shape of the lemur over the sketch.
steps.description: Occasionally make the line using short light strokes to suggest hair.

steps.headline: Line the drawing with a black liner.
steps.description: Erase the pencil and add in color. Follow the illustration for reference. If you want to draw a Ring Tailed Lemur, Draw in dark lines over the tail.

text:
{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/ee/Draw-a-circle-Step-1-8.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/ee/Draw-a-circle-Step-1-8.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":422,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":696.6666666666666,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"}Start by drawing a circle. This will be the head. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/4a/Draw-two-ovals-Step-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/4a/Draw-two-ovals-Step-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":428,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":706.8,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"}Draw an oval at each upper side of the circle head. These will be the ears. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/8/8f/Sketch-face-Step-3-1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/8/8f/Sketch-face-Step-3-1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":420,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":694.1333333333333,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"}Sketch the face. Inside the circle draw two small circles. Under the ovals draw an oval with a small circle inside it. Under the circle head draw a big oval with the lower part tilted to the right. This will be the body. On the left upper part of the body oval draw a hand. Draw two big vertical overlapping ovals. Draw a circle over the end of the second vertical oval. Draw five flat ovals over the circle. Under the sketch hand draw a big oval. This will be an upper part of the leg. Starting from the right lower part of the body oval draw a long curved cylindrical shape reaching over the left upper part of the body oval. This will be the tail. Now neatly outline the shape of the lemur over the sketch. Occasionally make the line using short light strokes to suggest hair. Line the drawing with a black liner. Erase the pencil and add in color. Follow the illustration for reference. If you want to draw a Ring Tailed Lemur, Draw in dark lines over the tail.
